alert.note: Alert for Graham; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 23 at 1:59AM CDT until April 23 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SHERIDAN AND WEST CENTRAL GRAHAM COUNTIES... At 159 AM CDT, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located 6 miles north of Morland, or 13 miles west of Hill City, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Sheridan and west central Graham Counties, including the following locations... Studley and Penokee. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
